# ssb-compose: an experiment in writing messages

I've been super hyped on a handful of things lately and I've been feeling tempted to smash them all together and try to make something interesting. The result is a tiny web app that runs locally and lets you compose messages with immediate feedback from ssb-markdown.

It's super simple *and* it works -- I'm using it right now!

- Type text into a simple `<textarea>`.
- Immediately see the results in a live-updating preview pane.
- Click \"publish\" and your text will be posted to Scuttlebutt.

I think I've been spending time trying to unravel implementation hairballs and **it's super refreshing to write something small from scratch**. Sure, it lacks all sorts of features (images, autocomplete, the `mentions` property, auto-save, and others), but it felt good to build and I wanted to share. I'll post a screenshot from a normal client and push up the source once it's a bit less broken.

I'm about to hit "publish", wish me luck!
